newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Fokker announcement seen within days.
newsitem.headline: Fokker announcement seen within days.

text.p: An announcement is likely within a few days on the outcome of talks on the future of bankrupt Dutch aircraft maker Fokker NV, a spokesman for Fokker's court-appointed administrators said on Friday.

He declined to comment on a report in De Volkskrant on Friday that the talks between the administrators and South Korea's Samsung Aerospace were nearing a climax. Samsung Aerospace has proposed a rescue plan for Fokker which would involve the Dutch government.
"I am quite certain that within a few days at least, news will be released one way or the other. The news could be positive or negative," the spokesman Ben Knueppe told Reuters.
But Knueppe said: "As far as the current state of negotiations is concerned, I'm not going to give any comment."
Fokker collapsed and went bankrupt on March 15, two months after its German parent Daimler Benz Aerospace cut vital credit lines. It has been kept alive since then by administrators.
Under the business plan Samsung presented earlier this month, the Dutch government is to take a minority stake in the new Fokker and provide large subsidies.
The administrators have previously told Fokker staff that the deadline for a rescue plan is at the end of this month.
A successful rescue depends on the purchase price, the establishment of a new aircraft leasing company and loans to develop a new 125-seat aircraft, larger than the company's current range of jets.

Dutch industrial systems group Stork NV bought Fokker Aviation, the profitable unit which is involved in parts, maintenance and product support, for 302.5 million guilders in July, leaving the aircraft manufacturing operations.
